pillar.title: Economics, Finance, Contracting and Business Structures
pillar.definition: All money flows and business mechanics of anesthesia – covering billing, reimbursement, RVUs, revenue cycle, subsidies, stipends, negotiation, 1099 economics, entity structures, agency dynamics, MSOs, private equity groups, and financial strategy for providers and organizations.
inclusion_tests: Is this about how money moves or how business entities are structured in anesthesia?
Is this about payment models, contract terms, or compensation formulas?
Is this about billing, coding, or reimbursement mechanics?
Is this about entity structures (PC, PLLC, S-Corp)?
Is this about agency economics, MSO fees, or PE investment models?
Is this about tax strategies, financial planning, or wealth building?
Is this about the financial mechanics of contract negotiation?
exclusion_tests: Clinical practice, physiology, patient care → Pillar 1
Role definitions, scope, training, credentialing, CRNA-MDA dynamics → Pillar 2
OR operations, equipment, IT systems, infrastructure → Pillar 3
Legal statutes, Stark Law text, Anti-Kickback statute, malpractice law, compliance rules → Pillar 4
Education methods, research, evidence-based practice → Pillar 6
Career decisions, leadership development, job market dynamics, W2→1099 transition decisions → Pillar 7
Burnout, wellbeing, culture, OR politics, DEI → Pillar 8

sub_pillars.title: Billing, Reimbursement, and Revenue Cycle
sub_pillars.definition: The technical mechanics of how anesthesia services generate revenue – from billing unit calculations and CPT coding to payer dynamics, revenue cycle management, and regulatory frameworks like the No Surprises Act. This sub-pillar covers the foundational 'money in' systems that convert clinical work into collectible revenue.

branches.title: Anesthesia Billing Unit System
branches.definition: The fundamental calculation methodology for anesthesia charges, including base units from the ASA Relative Value Guide, time unit calculations, modifying units for patient acuity and emergencies, and conversion factors that translate units into dollars.
branches.lens: Understanding how anesthesia services are quantified for billing purposes

branches.title: Anesthesia CPT Coding and Modifiers
branches.definition: The anesthesia-specific CPT code structure (00100-01999), code selection methodology, and the critical modifiers (AA, QZ, QK, QX, physical status, emergency) that determine how claims are processed and reimbursed.
branches.lens: Mastering the coding language that drives anesthesia reimbursement

branches.title: Payer Landscape and Reimbursement Variation
branches.definition: How different payers (Medicare, Medicaid, commercial insurers, workers compensation, self-pay) reimburse anesthesia services, including rate structures, policy variations, and the strategic implications of payer mix.
branches.lens: Navigating the diverse payer ecosystem and its financial impact

branches.title: Revenue Cycle Management
branches.definition: The end-to-end process of converting anesthesia services into collected revenue, including front-end verification, charge capture, claims submission, denial management, collections, and key performance metrics.
branches.lens: Optimizing the operational systems that maximize revenue capture

branches.title: Payment Policy Evolution and Alternative Models
branches.definition: How payment policy changes like the No Surprises Act, Independent Dispute Resolution processes, and emerging alternative payment models (bundled payments, value-based care) are reshaping anesthesia reimbursement economics.
branches.lens: Navigating the evolving payment landscape for financial optimization

sub_pillars.title: Compensation Models and Contract Economics
sub_pillars.definition: How individual anesthesia providers are paid and the contractual arrangements governing employment, independent contractor, and locum tenens work. This sub-pillar covers W2 salary structures, 1099 rate mechanics, per diem and call compensation, employment contract anatomy, and the strategies and tactics of rate negotiation.

branches.title: W2 Employment Compensation Structures
branches.definition: How employed anesthesia providers are compensated, including base salary models, production-based incentives, benefits valuation, and the differences between hospital employment and anesthesia group employment.
branches.lens: Understanding the full economics of employed positions

branches.title: Independent Contractor and 1099 Economics
branches.definition: The financial mechanics of 1099 independent contractor work, including rate structures, negotiation factors, what's included versus excluded, and the true economic comparison between 1099 and W2 arrangements.
branches.lens: Evaluating and optimizing independent contractor compensation

branches.title: Locum Tenens, Per Diem, and Variable Compensation
branches.definition: The economics of temporary and variable work arrangements, including agency rate structures, compensation packages, per diem scheduling economics, call pay structures, and academic/teaching compensation.
branches.lens: Maximizing value from flexible work arrangements

branches.title: Employment and Contractor Contract Anatomy
branches.definition: The essential terms, structures, and potential pitfalls of anesthesia employment contracts and independent contractor agreements, including non-competes, termination provisions, tail coverage, and red flags.
branches.lens: Analyzing contracts for financial and professional protection

branches.title: Rate Negotiation Strategies and Tactics
branches.definition: The methods and approaches for negotiating compensation, including market research, preparation frameworks, negotiation tactics, and handling common scenarios from initial offers to annual raises.
branches.lens: Securing optimal compensation through effective negotiation

sub_pillars.title: Business Entities, Practice Models, and Organizational Economics
sub_pillars.definition: How anesthesia practices are structured as business entities and the economic dynamics of different practice models. This sub-pillar covers entity formation (PC, PLLC, S-Corp), hospital-employed economics, private group structures, private equity and MSO arrangements, CRNA-owned practices, ACT model economics, and facility subsidies and stipends.

branches.title: Professional Entity Structures and Formation
branches.definition: The legal and tax structures available for anesthesia practices, including Professional Corporations, PLLCs, S-Corp elections, sole proprietorship considerations, multi-state entity requirements, and ongoing maintenance obligations.
branches.lens: Selecting and maintaining the optimal business entity structure

branches.title: Hospital-Employed Model Economics
branches.definition: The financial dynamics of hospital-employed anesthesia departments, including revenue and cost structures, subsidy relationships, productivity expectations, and the advantages and disadvantages of this model.
branches.lens: Understanding the economics of hospital employment

branches.title: Private Anesthesia Group Economics
branches.definition: The business mechanics of private practice anesthesia groups, including revenue sources, expense structures, profit distribution models, partnership economics, buy-in/buy-out arrangements, and governance.
branches.lens: Navigating the economics of private group practice

branches.title: Private Equity and MSO Economics
branches.definition: How private equity investment and management services organizations operate in anesthesia, including acquisition models, MSO fee structures, financial impact on providers, transparency issues, and recent trends and regulatory scrutiny.
branches.lens: Understanding the PE/MSO landscape and its implications

branches.title: Alternative Practice Models and Facility Economics
branches.definition: The economics of non-traditional practice structures including CRNA-owned practices, Anesthesia Care Team model economics, and facility-specific considerations for ASCs, rural hospitals, and academic medical centers.
branches.lens: Evaluating diverse practice model opportunities

branches.title: Subsidies, Stipends, and Facility Support
branches.definition: How hospitals financially support anesthesia services through subsidies, call stipends, coverage payments, administrative stipends, recruitment incentives, and pass-through arrangements, including fair market value requirements.
branches.lens: Structuring and negotiating facility financial support

sub_pillars.title: Financial Planning, Tax Strategy, and Market Intelligence
sub_pillars.definition: Strategic financial optimization for anesthesia professionals and organizations, including tax planning, wealth building, and market analysis. This sub-pillar covers W2 vs 1099 tax comparison, entity-level tax strategies, multi-state taxation, retirement planning, agency economics, compensation benchmarking, supply-demand dynamics, and financial decision frameworks.

branches.title: Tax Planning and Employment Model Tax Economics
branches.definition: The tax implications of different employment models, including W2 vs 1099 taxation, self-employment tax strategies, S-Corp salary/distribution optimization, entity-level tax planning, and multi-state tax considerations for locums work.
branches.lens: Minimizing tax burden across employment structures

branches.title: Financial Planning and Wealth Building
branches.definition: Personal financial optimization for anesthesia professionals, including cash flow management for variable income, insurance needs, retirement plan strategies, student loan approaches, asset protection, and long-term wealth building.
branches.lens: Building financial security and long-term wealth

branches.title: Agency and Intermediary Economics
branches.definition: How staffing agencies, vendor management systems, and management services organizations operate financially, including agency revenue models, markup structures, direct contracting alternatives, and evaluating intermediary value.
branches.lens: Understanding and navigating intermediary economics

branches.title: Compensation Benchmarking and Market Dynamics
branches.definition: How to assess compensation competitiveness using survey data, geographic variations, supply-demand dynamics, economic cycle impacts, and total compensation package evaluation frameworks.
branches.lens: Using market intelligence for compensation decisions

branches.title: Financial Analysis and Decision Frameworks
branches.definition: Tools and methodologies for financial decision-making, including hourly equivalency calculations, total compensation modeling, contract value assessment, practice profitability analysis, and career financial trade-off frameworks.
branches.lens: Applying analytical rigor to financial decisions
